documents.document: @philtastro will try and get some next time they come through!
Hung a CD in the fig tree to repel the currawongs. Now they aren't around, we have (loud) corellas
This out of date emergency sign with terrible grammar also serves as a reminder for RSAA PhD students https://t.co/qT93RT7r42
Old keyboard died, so now I have a new keyboard and it is even louder than the temporary Sun Microsystems one I was using.
A series of tubes... https://t.co/UsoeT9sebS
That feel when someone is using ur photo as a promotional picture https://t.co/3PUATmPW5C
Edited the data reduction pipeline without breaking it. May have bounced around the office a bit too enthusiastically
.@philtastro @photonhandler this is relevant to our interests https://t.co/Y805eHDWdn
Looking at results from my work and seeing the paper I'm gonna write coming together https://t.co/K98t1f12dd
I went 2 nights with no server resets. H o w ...
My entire life has been a lie. I thought the cheese and gas interacted https://t.co/AcrA1JTRTU
We have had 0 server crashes so far and tbh I have no idea what to do with myself. So much free time for activities
We're officially out of ToOs to look at! On to some SN Host galaxies! https://t.co/PkK1VaTfwy
@DoctorJeph it's gonna have to happen soon with ours
@DoctorJeph yep. Those things would never cross our threshold
Day 375: the hot dog shape incarceration continues #freetheshapes https://t.co/Go7mAS6ZBD
@novaric thanks! We had a good night tonight. Hopefully the weather continues to hold out!
@novaric thanks! I'm considering opening an etsy shop but the fact the ink runs if they get wet makes me reluctant
Final galaxy of the night is full of surprises - I can see strong emission in the raw data (possibly SII)
Clouds marching across the all sky cam https://t.co/b2YzLsz78w
Spoke too soon. Clouds moved in and ruined our 4th target :(
On to target number 4 for the night. We're on a roll!
We've been learning about SN nucleosynthesis this evening (in between setting up observations) https://t.co/K3zOaoELAi
Right as I want to start observing my targets, the cloud returns
@JustinList God damn , I thought you were referring to the image of a galaxy I tweeted earlier! Safe to say this fella is very nearby
@JustinList Not sure, but probably 12 or so thousand parsecs (1 parsec ~ 3 light years, and 1AU ~ 8 light minutes)
The aliens have arrived. I for one welcome our grasshopper overlords https://t.co/ZmSUwREIvG
@philtastro yeah, it's only like a few thousand parsecs away
@philtastro Yup. I headed out to Andromeda to observe tonight
#observations https://t.co/oGOpTZG6av
Currently observing a target of opportunity in this beauty https://t.co/MGOLTSb8hk
Geddy Lee screams in the distance https://t.co/mKKbvBiT8c
OMG the clouds might be dissipating. Maybe.
@DRG_physics oh goodness I'm so jealous! What an awesome experience!
@DoctorJeph and it's beautiful seeing here in Canberra.
@DoctorJeph if I have to watch clouds blow through until 3:30am I will lose it
Interesting chap - wallaby of some kind https://t.co/DzgDOlL0dz
@astrostew but what will I occupy myself with during my hour long exposures tonight?
I forgot my phone charger. This is a disaster
Observing ennui. I was too organised and I have nothing to do until I think about opening at 1930 https://t.co/nkIA3tWk4T
I'm observing tonight and tomorrow on ANU's 2.3m telescope - looking at galaxies where my favorite type of weird supernovae occur
Observing plan coming together ~12 hr before first target rises. First step is "Check the bloody dichroic is the correct one"
I have no idea how I did it but I made the TV work by wiggling the co-ax and my flatmates think I'm a witch https://t.co/b9ByY9AyRV
Aaaand just as I prepare for the HPC runs they take the damned machine offline for an upgrade https://t.co/1JjYkQ9eZR
Ready for Australia Day https://t.co/VOdvGIVIaU
Officemate: my galaxy gave birth to babies! Me: I don't think that's how cosmology is supposed to work... https://t.co/fMQXtaeYPD
Getting some neat results from my project right now https://t.co/JRXu7qb12b
Impressive Canberra sky tonight @StormHour (no filter needed!) https://t.co/SUsn4pxgg4
Mostly looking good 3 days in. And we have flowers on the tomato plant and chillies growing https://t.co/uO52keErOI
Phys Rev now asks you to identify either Albert Einstein or Marie Curie when downloading papers!
It's called fashion. Look it up. https://t.co/yMb9RH0zcU
@AshleeMParkes I made mine using some white sneakers from Kmart and a fabric sharpie :)
When u get blessed by the weather gods (next observing run on Friday/Saturday) https://t.co/j9G35M7kjo
I wish I had been more imaginative when naming my code tbh https://t.co/xYY3Hq0jxi
Today's shoe situation: Feynman diagrams https://t.co/WgwVyB1l7R
I mean sure I could probably build my own plug in, but I actually have real research to do so...
it's a shame twitter's mute feature only works on direct tweets, not mentions, newspaper articles about, retweets...
Day 370: no reprieve in sight. Hot dog shape inprisonment continues https://t.co/SBOePZtYHb
@antDigital it may have changed, but I've seen it discussed as a digital security problem (people posting pics of boarding passes)
@antDigital usually need the details available on the boarding pass - surname, booking ref etc.
@antDigital yup. I recently heard about the passenger reference number one - people cancelling your flight once you've checked in
Also, stop posting your passport number. You're opening yourself up to identity theft and tax fraud
@antDigital I've seen several on Twitter today. All info needed to cancel booking was visible on boarding pass
If people see your ref number and name, they can actually cancel your ticket
FYI: if you're travelling somewhere, don't post photos of your boarding pass where your passport number and ticket ref can be seen
@dr_dbw this is why I didn't go into experimental physics
Oh my god it's gonna die anyway https://t.co/Tj4QG7dtkF
@dr_dbw well it looked like Rosemary from the side (also turns out it has 0 culinary uses) https://t.co/z4exYfeuMu
Me: and I bought a Rosemary plant too Flat mate: that isn't Rosemary, that's a curry plant Flat mate: it literallyâ€¦ https://t.co/O8DeXVUoYq
They call them that because you don't particularly want them in your house https://t.co/O0giBTOznH
Don't talk to me or my daughter again https://t.co/ZwyTF0PMsq
@photonhandler blackcurrant hole sounds a bit... Rude
@photonhandler I have to go out and buy another 24 now. We do have fairy mass f-loss though
Because the original space themed zooper doopers weren't sciency enough https://t.co/daMKCrILy0
Mood tbh https://t.co/Sd5uKE9Iv2

Fri: never mind. You were right all along.
We're bringing back the variable adiabatic gamma!!
Tue: model works Wed: model impeded by transcendental equation Thurs: transcendental equation has no solution
.@photonhandler: maybe the real funding was the friends we made along the way
@DoctorJeph could also be it. That inversion thing that happens around Coona always throws me when I'm observing
@DoctorJeph @stevebiddle @MetService I've noticed the Canberra radar starts picking up 'rain' in the evenings. People using wifi?
It is borderline COLD in Canberra this evening and it is FANTASTIC
Day 367: hot dog flavour shapes are still in the fridge https://t.co/R9LUPZYyCT
I DID THE THING
@philuponscience A coffee can was used to help it vacate the premises
@photonhandler and the cold taps at stromlo produce hot water anyway in this weather (as I found out AFTER burning my hand)
@DRG_physics @photonhandler I've had school kids argue with me that blue stars are cool because that's how taps are labelled ðŸ˜‚
You can now see my CSIRO Bolton and Student symposium slide at https://t.co/BUTFmFXk0I
Success! Calculated radiative temperature evolution of an adiabatically expanding bubble!
Running into lots of astronomers out running/in the gym of late. 2017 is the year of the buff astronomer I guess
@astro_jje @Knhannah @CatherineQ @SpaceLauren @BasilLeaf gosh I just got in the car and saw this! Thank you so much for sharing my writing!
@antDigital the trouble with a lot of skeptics is they take a fraction of a community and then generalise. Then again, I'm doing the same!
@Knhannah same. Christian independent school for 6 yr then into state schools with compulsory comp. religion up to Y11
@Knhannah honestly I've only come across this in Aus/NZ. Correlates with no compulsory comparative religion classes at any stage
"But as a scientist you rationally know there is no evidence for God's existence" "Well someone gave me the patience to put up with you"
"You believe in God - you must be stupid" "Well I'd argue that my BSc(Hons) in physics and half-finished PhD disputes that"
@Knhannah @TristanRS @DoctorJeph when we were observing @photonhandler coloured in a pic of the rover for my officeâ€¦ https://t.co/YVM0z5N35a
@philuponscience We had one of those incidents a few years ago. Baby brown in ladies bathroom.
@Knhannah Sorry, I just get so frustrated with some of the cynicism in the scicomm and science community.
@nicgaston @REasther @Knhannah @DoctorJeph that's always been my scicomm manifesto: Come as you are, take what you need/want
@Knhannah and having colleagues tell you you've been "brainwashed" bc you have religious/spiritual beliefs (which do not conflict w. sci)
